title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If a file is already opened in one editor, there should be an error message when attempting to open it in another editor.
OB:
1. Open a file in the workbench editor.
2. Right-click on the same file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
3. Nothing happens.

Expected Behavior:
EB: When attempting to open a file in another editor that is already opened in one editor, a warning message should be displayed in the workbench stating that there are unsaved changes and asking if you want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed stating that all files need to be closed first.
SR:
1. Close the file that is already opened in the workbench editor.
2. Go to the Java Perspective.
3. Double-click on a Java file to open it in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the same Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.

Note: Ensure that there are unsaved changes in the file that was previously opened in the workbench editor before performing step 4.
